info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 10:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 1115 PM MDT... At 1038 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northwest of Maljamar, or 32 miles west of Lovington, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Chaves County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
